wireless.repeater_using_tips: The entry cannot be modified when repeater is enabled.
wireless.enable_dfs_tips: If the router is assigned to use a DFS channel, then a channel availability check is required every time Wi-Fi is enabled, during this time the 5GHz signal will not be available for connections, this process takes $$$$. If the router detects that the radar is using the current channel, it will temporarily disconnect from the client and switch to another available channel; additionally, 5GHz Wi-Fi will be temporarily turned off whilst the router is scanning for available, nearby networks.
wireless.dsf_starting: Checking for channel availability. This process will take $$$$. Please wait……
wireless.dsf_conflict: 5GHz Wi-Fi is temporarily unavailable because a radar is using the channel that the router is currently using.
wireless.channel_auto_dfs_tips: When your bandwidth is set to 160 MHz, Wi-Fi will always use the DFS channel, even if you choose a non-DFS channel or the "$$$$" option.
wireless.channel_auto_tips: When you select the "$$$$" option, Wi-Fi will not automatically switch to the DFS channel.
wireless.lan_guest_conflict_tips: To avoid conflict between {lan} and {guest}, guest Wi-Fi cannot be activated.
wireless.random_bssid_enabled_tips: If this option is enabled, the device uses a randomly generated BSSID and renews it at each reboot.
wireless.random_bssid_disabled_tips: Using a static BSSID may cause you to be tracked. If your client device requires the use of a static BSSID, it is recommended that you set the SSID to hidden. {more}
wireless.mlo_wifi_security_tips: WPA3-SAE is suitable for most devices that support MLO, and this protocol is recommended.
wireless.radio_bands_tips: Please select at least two radio bands.
wireless.enable_psc_tips: When PSC (Preferred Scanning Channel) is enabled, only channels with higher connectivity will be reserved to ensure 6GHz device connections.
wireless.mlo_6g_bssid_tips: If the MLO Wi-Fi radio bands include 6 GHz, the MLO Wi-Fi BSSID will synchronize when the 6GHz Wi-Fi BSSID changes.
